revised_title: Ergot and Gangrene: A Case Study from Wattisham Parish
tldr: This article presents a case study of a family in Wattisham parish affected by a rare disease causing gangrene. The author, Mr. Bones, investigates the possible causes and links the disease to the consumption of contaminated rye bread containing ergot. The article discusses the similarities between this disease and the French epidemical gangrene described in the Histoire de l'Academie Royale des Sciences. Although the exact cause remains unknown, the author suggests that ergot might be responsible for the disease.
